SENT.plain: Porokeratosis is an abnormal disease of keratinization of epidermis
It is clinically characterized by margins covered with keratin layer and it typically has an atrophied macule with a protruded, circular form
Histopathologically, it shows the findings of cornoid lamella
Risk factors for its development include organ transplantation, long-term use of corticosteroids, immunocompromised status, including AIDS, and exposure to ultraviolet light
We herein report a case of atypical porokeratosis in a 38-year-old man who developed porokeratosis involving multiple sites following bone marrow transplantation for myelodysplastic syndrome
